result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Daniels

records.addlTxt: from Jackson County, IA Sheriff's Dept.

4:00 PM Defendant Michael A. Daniels in court.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for Michael A. Daniels. State recites joint recommendation: Cts 1 & 2: DPA - 18 mo.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Defendant sworn by the Clerk. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and defers the sentence accordingly.

10:31 AM Defendant Michael A. Daniels appeared by zoom/telephone.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh appeared in person for Michael A. Daniels.  Request for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:57 AM Defendant Michael A. Daniels in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Waiver of formal reading of complaint.  NG plea entered.    Court advises defendant of representation rights/options.  Defendant will contact SPD.  If defendant has counsel at next hearing, he may appear via phone or zoom, otherwise, he will need to appear in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact with K.C. or her residence
